project.name: TPP-Metric Domain v1
project.description:
The TPP (Travelling Purchase Problem) consists in selecting a subset of markets such that a given demand of each product can be purchased, minimizing the routing cost and the purchasing cost.
This version is equivalent to the original formulation of TPP in OR. There are only three operators, two of which are used to model the purchasing actions: "buy-all" and "buy-allneeded". The first buys at a certain market the whole amount of a good sold by the market while the second one buys at market the amount of goods that is needed to complete the purchase of goods (as specified in the problem goals). Note that every market is directly connected to every other market and to the depots. Moreover, there is only one depot and only one truck.

useCase.name: Truck buy all goods from Market
Truck buy all needed goods from Market

state.name: Truck buy all or buy all needed goods

action.postcondition: t.at=to and totalCost = totalCost + driveCost(from, to)

action.precondition: t.at=m and m.onSale(g)>0 and m.onSale(g)>(request(g) - bought(g))
action.postcondition: m.onSale(g)=m.onSale(g)-(request(g) - bought(g)) and totalCost = totalCost + ((request(g) - bought(g)) * m.price(g))
